Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effect of Local Corticosteroids on Dysphagia in ACDF Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: In this prospective, randomised controlled trial, 30 patients aged 20-80 years undergoing ACDF were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either 10 mg of local triamcinolone or saline solution

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of local corticosteroids on dysphagia in patients undergoing anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the upper esophageal sphincter (UES) relaxation pressure, measured preoperatively and at 1 month postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation performed using a computer spreadsheet and allocation concealed from patients and analysts

Blinding.evidence: The treating physician was blinded during swallowing assessments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty patients completed the study, with 15 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Thirty patients completed the study, with 15 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median postoperative UES relaxation pressure was significantly lower in the corticosteroid group (24.5 mm Hg) compared to the saline group (33.6 mm Hg; mean difference = -9.1 mm Hg, 95% CI -15.8 to -2.4; p = 0.01).
